description: Swindon Town manager Ian Holloway is charged with misconduct by the Football Association after allegedly abusing a match official.
title: Ian Holloway: Swindon Town manager handed FA misconduct charge
title_page: Ian Holloway: Swindon Town manager handed FA misconduct charge - BBC Sport
maintext:
Swindon Town boss Ian Holloway has been charged with misconduct by the Football Association after his sending-off in their League Two win over Chesterfield.
Holloway was dismissed less than a quarter of an hour into Saturday's 1-0 victory after disputing a caution for Robins striker Harry Smith.
"It's alleged the manager acted in an improper manner and/or used abusive and/or insulting words towards a match official in the 11th minute and after being sent off," an FA statement said., external
Holloway has been given until Monday, 3 March to respond to the charge. His Swindon side are 15th in League Two and they visit leaders Walsall on Saturday.
